MediaElementAudioSourceNode.summary: The MediaElementAudioSourceNode interface represents an audio source consisting of an HTML {{ htmlelement("audio") }} or {{ htmlelement("video") }} element. It is an that acts as an audio source.

remarks.para: A MediaElementAudioSourceNode has no inputs and exactly one output, and is created using the method. The number of channels in the output equals the number of channels of the audio referenced by the used in the creation of the node, or is 1 if the has no audio.

MediaElementAudioSourceNodeMediaElement.summary:
The interface's
read-only mediaElement property indicates the
that contains the audio track from which the node is
receiving audio.

remarks.para:
This stream was specified when the node was first created,
either using the
constructor or the method.

MediaElementAudioSourceNodeMediaElement.value:
An representing the element which contains the source
of audio for the node.

MediaElementAudioSourceNodeMediaElementA.summary: The MediaElementAudioSourceNode() constructor creates a new object instance.
